#summary The rel="alternate stylesheet" attribute indicates that the referenced document is an alternate stylesheet for the current document.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute,from-w3c

`rel="alternate stylesheet"` is one of several [LinkTypes link types] for describing relationships between documents.

== Usage ==

== Elements ==

You can use the `rel="alternate stylesheet"` attribute on these elements:

  * [LinkElement <link>]

== Browser compatibility ==

|| *Test* || *IE8* || *IE7* || *FF3* || *FF2* || *Saf3* ||
